p: The Enteric Cytopathic Human Orphan (ECHO) virus, belongs to the Picornaviridae family. Enteroviruses are mainly found in the gastrointestinal tract, and can cause opportunistic infections mainly in children by indirect faecalâ€“oral transmission, causing febrile illness (Sherris Medical Microbiology 2004). HNP-1 peptide was tested for its antiviral activity against this non-enveloped RNA virus without showing any direct antiviral effect at concentrations of peptide known to inhibit HSV-1 (Daher et al. 1986).
